discussion.content:
If they aim to filter 10.10.10.0/24, then I would expect to see something like this: 
ip access-list standard EIGRP-FILTER
permit 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255

route-map EIGRP deny 10
match ip address EIGRP-FILTER
route-map EIGRP permit 20

comments.content: Agree that B is closest to a coherent answer.
you have a reason, this question is wrong. But I need choice on aswer. I thinsg option B.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

There is no valid answer of this one...
When you use a route-map in the acl you permit the traffic so that you match that traffic, then in the route-map you are going to configure what will be done to that traffic

Selected Answer: B
needs to be wildcard mask

Selected Answer: B
ACL uses wildcard mask.

comments.content: ACLs use wildcard masks, not subnet masks.
My bad even standard acl use wildcard

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This is standard ACL, A is the correct answer

choices.D: There is a permit in the route map that allows this prefix. A deny 20 statement is required with no match condition to block the prefix.
choices.A: There is a permit in the ACL that allows this prefix into EIGRP. The ACL should be modified to deny 10.10.10.0 255.255.255.0.
choices.C: There is a permit in the route map that allows this prefix. A deny 20 statement is required with a match condition to match a new ACL that denies all prefixes.
choices.B: There is a permit in the ACL that allows this prefix into EIGRP. The ACL should be modified to deny 10.10.10.0 0.0.0.255.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must filter EIGRP updates that are received to block all 10.10.10.0/24 prefixes. The engineer tests the distribute list and finds one associated prefix. Which action resolves the issue?

A network engineer must configure a DMVPN network so that a spoke establishes a direct path to another spoke if the two must send traffic to each other. A spoke must send traffic directly to the hub if required. Which configuration meets this requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
B and D is very simillar, but if look to "ip nhrp map multicast dynamic" is the correct command and give only in D option.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
Main 2 points to look at in the differences.
-Spoke-to-spoke communication = ip nhrp redirect (hub) ip nhrp shortcut (spokes)
-tunnel mode gre multipoint

Selected Answer: D
The given answer is correct.

Selected Answer: D
D is the corrrect
ez

Selected Answer: D
Verified it with lab with Network Lessons.

choices.C:
At the hub router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp nhs multicast dynamic
ip nhrp nhs shortcut
tunnel mode gre multipoint

On the spokes router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp nhs multicast dynamic
ip nhrp nhs redirect
tunnel mode gre multipoint
choices.A:
At the hub router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp nhs dynamic multipoint
ip nhrp nhs shortcut
tunnel mode gre multicast

On the spokes router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp nhs multicast dynamic
ip nhrp nhs redirect
tunnel mode gre multicast
choices.B:
At the hub router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp map dynamic multipoint
ip nhrp redirect
tunnel mode gre multicast

On the spokes router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp map multicast dynamic
ip nhrp shortcut
tunnel mode gre multicast
choices.D:
At the hub router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp map multicast dynamic
ip nhrp redirect
tunnel mode gre multipoint

On the spokes router:
interface tunnel10
ip nhrp map multicast dynamic
ip nhrp shortcut
tunnel mode gre multipoint

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
aaa new-model
!
tacacs server ISE1
 address ipv4 192.168.1.5
 key Cisco123
!
aaa group server tacacs+ TAC-SERV
 server name ISE1
!
aaa authentication login telnet group TAC-SERV
!
R5(config)#line vty 0 4
R5(config-line)#login authentication TAC-SERV
AAA: Warning authentication list "TAC-SERV" is not defined for LOGIN.

R5(config-line)#login authentication telnet 
R5(config-line)#end
R5#
aaa authentication methode called "telnet" was created, but not used under the vty lines.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

It's a little tricky, but basically the authentication list created is called telnet
you define the name of the authentication list after aaa authentication login <NAME OF THE AUTHENTICATION LIST> group <TACACS SERVER GROUP NAME>

For correct authentication under the vty line interfaces we need to apply this authentication list by applying the command

line vty 0 15
login authentication <NAME OF THE AUTHENTICATION LIST>

So the correct answer is D NOT A because A is the name of the server group and NOT of the authentication list

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

yes optiion D

D is correct

i think A

　(config-line)# login authentication [ default | list-name ]

questions.question_text:
The network administrator configured R1 to authenticate Telnet connections based on Cisco ISE using TACACS+. ISE has been configured with an IP address of 192.168.1.5 and with a network device pointing toward R1 (192.168.1.1) with a shared secret password of Cisco123.

The administrator has configured this on R1:

aaa new-model
!
tacacs server ISE1
address ipv4 192.168.1.5
key Cisco123
!
aaa group server tacacs+ TAC-SERV
server name ISE1
!
aaa authentication login telnet group TAC-SERV

The network administrator cannot authenticate to R1 based on ISE. Which configuration fixes the issue?

choices.C:
aaa group server radius RAD-SERV
server name ISE1
choices.B:
aaa group server tacacs+ ISE1
server name RAD-SERV

comments.content: Correct. Default method group is placed automatically under line vty 0 4 when aaa new-model is actiavted

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C:
Router is using default method: #aaa authentication login default group RAD-SERV
that calls a group RAD-SERV (which is a tacas+ in this scenario), but the question asks about a radius server config, not tacacs+. So we need to configure a radius group named RAD-SERV.

Selected Answer: C
"aaa group server tacacs+" is incorrect in this case!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

aaa new-model
aaa authentication login default group radius
!
aaa group server radius RAD
 server name SERV_RADIUS
!
radius server SERV_RADIUS
 address ipv4 <RADIUS-ADDRESS>
 key <string>
!

Selected Answer: C
Given answer is correct, We are talking about radius not tacacs. So Radius must be fix.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

RADIUS not TACACS

Selected Answer: C
option C 100 %%% correct

questions.question_text:
The network administrator must configure R1 to authenticate Telnet connections based on Cisco ISE using RADIUS. ISE has been configured with an IP address of 192.168.1.5 and with a network device pointing toward R1 (192.168.1.1) with a shared secret password of Cisco123.
The administrator has configured this on R1:

aaa new-model
!
radius server ISE1
address ipv4 192.168.1.5
key Cisco123
!
aaa group server tacacs+ RAD-SERV
server name ISE1
!
aaa authentication login default group RAD-SERV

The network administrator cannot authenticate to access R1 based on ISE. Which set of configurations fixes the issue?

discussion.content:
D is ok.

It's written for ex : match ip adress WAN_PREFIXES
and should be : match ip adress prefix-list WAN_PREFIXES

Same for LOCAL_PREFIXES & VPN_PREFIXES

Selected Answer: D
D is ok.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

Selected Answer: D
R1(config-route-map)#match ip address ?
 <1-199> IP access-list number
 <1300-2699> IP access-list number (expanded range)
 WORD IP access-list name
 prefix-list Match entries of prefix-lists

D is corrrect. Prefix-list in route-maps shoujld be specified using prefix list keyword. Otherwise, route-map takes it for access-list

ER1(config-route-map)#match ip address ?
 <1-199> IP access-list number
 <1300-2699> IP access-list number (expanded range)
 WORD IP access-list name
 prefix-list Match entries of prefix-lists

choices.D: The route map must have the keyword prefix-list to evaluate the prefix list entries
choices.C: The OSPF process must have a metric when redistributing prefixes from EIGRP
choices.A: The route map EIGRP->OSPF must have the 10.0.106.0/24 entry to exist in one of the three prefix lists to pass
choices.B: EIGRP must redistribute the 10.0.106.0/24 route instead of using the network statement
